concept.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a rule or idea saying how something should be done
concept.translation[1].definitions[2].de: an economic idea stating that companies should make products which customers say they want, rather than products customers have to be persuaded to buy
concept.translation[1].definitions[3].de: an economic idea stating that companies should continuously try to improve their products because customers prefer to buy products with the best quality, features, and performance
concept.translation[1].definitions[4].de: an economic idea stating that companies should continuously try to manufacture and deliver their products without wasting time, money, or energy because customers want goods that are low in price and easy to obtain
concept.translation[1].definitions[4].ex: The main objective of firms adhering to the production concept is to minimize costs, yet still maintain product quality.
concept.translation[1].definitions[5].de: an economic idea stating that companies should try to sell the products they already have, rather than develop new products
